unnormalised: My first experience with Indian Railways was… well, let's just say it was memorable. I was prepping for a trip from Mumbai to Delhi, a journey of about 1400 km. Booked a 3AC ticket on the Rajdhani Express. My friend, Rohan, kept telling me to prepone my schedule if I could, as the monsoon season tends to delay trains. But, being the typical last-minute person, I didn't heed his advice.
normalised: My first experience with Indian Railways was… well, let's just say it was memorable. I was prepping for a trip from Mumbai to Delhi, a journey of about one thousand four hundred kilometer. Booked a three A-C ticket on the Rajdhani Express. My friend, Rohan, kept telling me to prepone my schedule if I could, as the monsoon season tends to delay trains. But, being the typical last-minute person, I didn't heed his advice.

unnormalised: The day of the journey, 15/07/2023, arrived. I reached Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, a magnificent structure in itself, around 4:30 PM for a 5:00 PM departure. The platform was a sea of humanity. After what felt like an eternity, I found my coach, A1, and my seat, 25. The train was packed, with families, students, and businessmen all vying for space.
normalised: The day of the journey, fifteenth july two thousand and twenty three, arrived. I reached Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus, a magnificent structure in itself, around four thirty P-M for a five P-M departure. The platform was a sea of humanity. After what felt like an eternity, I found my coach, A one, and my seat, twenty five. The train was packed, with families, students, and businessmen all vying for space.

unnormalised: The train started with a jerk, and we were off. The initial few hours were spent watching the landscape whiz by – fields, small villages, and the occasional glimpse of city life. Dinner was served around 8:30 PM; a standard fare of dal, roti, and sabzi. The pantry car guys were hawking chai every hour; Rs. 10 a cup. Not bad, I thought.

unnormalised: Around 3:00 AM the next day, I was jolted awake. The train had stopped. An announcement crackled over the loudspeaker, informing us of a delay due to heavy rainfall and waterlogging on the tracks near Kota. We were stuck for nearly 6 hours. Passengers started getting restless, exchanging stories of their own railway adventures (or misadventures). Some even started impromptu card games.
normalised: Around three A-M the next day, I was jolted awake. The train had stopped. An announcement crackled over the loudspeaker, informing us of a delay due to heavy rainfall and waterlogging on the tracks near Kota. We were stuck for nearly six hours. Passengers started getting restless, exchanging stories of their own railway adventures (or misadventures). Some even started impromptu card games.

unnormalised: Finally, around 9:00 AM, the train started moving again. We reached Delhi at approximately 2:00 PM on 16/07/2023, seven hours behind schedule. Exhausted but somehow exhilarated, I stepped onto the platform, forever etched with the chaos, camaraderie, and sheer unpredictability that is Indian Railways. Will I travel by train again? Absolutely. Just maybe not during the monsoons.
